intro: Minuartia tenuifolia, commonly known as the slender sandwort, is a flowering plant native to arctic and alpine regions. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, white or pink flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Minuartia tenuifolia thrives in rocky soils and is often found in mountainous and polar environments.
